message.content: Now I can see the specific code review feedback. The main issue is that the imports were changed from relative to absolute, which is inconsistent and can cause issues. Let me fix this by changing the imports back to relative imports:

function.arguments: {"command": "str_replace", "path": "/workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py", "old_str": "from feed_service import update_all_feeds, fetch_and_update_feed, fetch_feed, process_feed_entries", "new_str": "from .feed_service import update_all_feeds, fetch_and_update_feed, fetch_feed, process_feed_entries", "security_risk": "LOW"}
function.name: str_replace_editor

content:
The file /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py has been edited. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py:
   166	# --- Feed Update Service and Scheduler ---
   167	
   168	# Import feed service functions
   169	from .feed_service import update_all_feeds, fetch_and_update_feed, fetch_feed, process_feed_entries
   170	
   171	# Configure the background scheduler
   172	UPDATE_INTERVAL_MINUTES_DEFAULT = 15
   173	# Get update interval from environment variable or use default
   174	
Review the changes and make sure they are as expected. Edit the file again if necessary.

extras.old_content: from feed_service import update_all_feeds, fetch_and_update_feed, fetch_feed, process_feed_entries
extras.new_content: from .feed_service import update_all_feeds, fetch_and_update_feed, fetch_feed, process_feed_entries
extras.diff:
--- /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py
+++ /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py
@@ -169 +169 @@
-from feed_service import update_all_feeds, fetch_and_update_feed, fetch_feed, process_feed_entries
+from .feed_service import update_all_feeds, fetch_and_update_feed, fetch_feed, process_feed_entries
